instructions.text: Split the vanilla pod in half and scrape out the seeds.
In a saucepan, heat the liquid cream, milk, seeds, and vanilla pod until boiling. Remove from the heat and let infuse for 1 hour.
Whisk the egg yolks with the sugar until the mixture becomes pale.
Remove the vanilla pod from the infused cream. Heat again. Once hot, slowly pour the cream over the egg yolks while whisking constantly.
Preheat the oven to 140¬∞C and divide the mixture into ramekins.
Place the ramekins in an ovenproof dish and add hot water halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Cook in a bain-marie for 45 minutes.
Let cool at room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Evenly sprinkle the tops of the creams with the brown sugar. Caramelize the sugar using a kitchen torch.

tips: Check the doneness of the creams after baking. They should be set but still slightly wobbly in the center.
If you do not have a torch, you can place the creams under the oven grill for a few minutes to caramelize the sugar.
Store the cr√®me br√ªl√©es in the refrigerator and consume within 2 days for best freshness.
For a variation, you can add orange or lemon zest to the cream before baking for a citrus touch.
